resources.name: Genki I: An Integrated Course in Elementary Japanese
resources.description: The most popular Japanese textbook for beginners worldwide.
resources.descriptionLong: Genki I is the gold standard for beginner Japanese textbooks, used in universities and language schools worldwide. It covers hiragana, katakana, basic kanji, grammar, vocabulary, and conversation through 12 lessons. The textbook includes dialogues, grammar explanations, exercises, and cultural notes. A workbook is available separately for additional practice.
resources.notes: Third edition released in 2020. Workbook sold separately.

resources.name: Genki II: An Integrated Course in Elementary Japanese
resources.description: Continuation of Genki I, completing the elementary level.
resources.descriptionLong: Genki II continues from where Genki I left off, covering lessons 13-23. It introduces more complex grammar patterns, additional kanji, and builds on the foundation established in the first book. Completing both Genki books brings learners to approximately JLPT N4 level.
resources.notes: Completes elementary Japanese. Prepares for intermediate study.

resources.name: Minna no Nihongo Shokyu I
resources.nameJa: みんなの日本語 初級I
resources.description: Popular textbook series used in Japanese language schools.
resources.descriptionLong: Minna no Nihongo is a comprehensive Japanese textbook series widely used in language schools in Japan. The main textbook is entirely in Japanese, with separate translation and grammar notes available in various languages. This immersive approach helps learners think in Japanese from the start.
resources.priceDetails: ~$50 for main text, additional books for grammar notes
resources.notes: Main text is in Japanese only. Buy translation notes separately.

resources.name: Minna no Nihongo Shokyu II
resources.nameJa: みんなの日本語 初級II
resources.description: Second volume of the Minna no Nihongo beginner series.
resources.descriptionLong: Minna no Nihongo Shokyu II continues the beginner course with lessons 26-50. It builds on the grammar and vocabulary from the first book and prepares learners for intermediate-level study. Like the first volume, it's written entirely in Japanese.
resources.notes: Completes the beginner level of Minna no Nihongo.

resources.name: Tobira: Gateway to Advanced Japanese
resources.description: Popular intermediate textbook bridging beginner to advanced.
resources.descriptionLong: Tobira is the go-to intermediate Japanese textbook for learners who have completed beginner materials like Genki. It covers grammar, reading, kanji, and cultural topics through 15 lessons. The textbook emphasizes reading comprehension and introduces learners to authentic Japanese texts.
resources.notes: Best used after completing Genki I & II or equivalent.

resources.name: Quartet I: Intermediate Japanese Across the Four Language Skills
resources.description: Modern intermediate textbook from the Genki publishers.
resources.descriptionLong: Quartet is a newer intermediate textbook series from the publishers of Genki. It focuses on developing all four language skills: reading, writing, listening, and speaking. The textbook uses contemporary topics and authentic materials to prepare learners for real-world Japanese use.
resources.notes: Natural progression from Genki series.

resources.name: Quartet II: Intermediate Japanese Across the Four Language Skills
resources.description: Second volume completing the Quartet intermediate series.
resources.descriptionLong: Quartet II continues the intermediate course, further developing reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills. It prepares learners for advanced study and real-world Japanese communication.
resources.notes: Completes the Quartet intermediate series.

resources.name: An Integrated Approach to Intermediate Japanese
resources.description: Comprehensive intermediate textbook with cultural focus.
resources.descriptionLong: An Integrated Approach to Intermediate Japanese is a well-established intermediate textbook that covers grammar, reading, writing, and conversation. It includes cultural readings and prepares learners for more advanced study.
resources.notes: Good alternative to Tobira for intermediate study.

resources.name: Authentic Japanese: Progressing from Intermediate to Advanced
resources.description: Advanced textbook focusing on authentic Japanese materials.
resources.descriptionLong: Authentic Japanese helps learners progress from intermediate to advanced levels using authentic Japanese materials. It covers complex grammar, nuanced vocabulary, and prepares learners for consuming native content.
resources.notes: For learners who have completed intermediate textbooks.

resources.name: Remembering the Kanji
resources.description: Mnemonic-based approach to learning kanji meanings.
resources.descriptionLong: Remembering the Kanji by James Heisig teaches the meanings and writing of over 2,000 kanji through imaginative stories and mnemonics. The method focuses on learning meanings first, with readings learned later through vocabulary. A controversial but effective approach for many learners.
resources.notes: Volume 1 covers meanings. Volume 2 covers readings.

resources.name: The Kodansha Kanji Learner's Course
resources.nameJa: 講談社漢字学習コース
resources.description: Systematic kanji course covering 2,300 characters.
resources.descriptionLong: The Kodansha Kanji Learner's Course presents 2,300 kanji in a carefully designed order that builds on previously learned characters. Each entry includes meanings, readings, vocabulary, and mnemonics. A comprehensive and well-organized approach to kanji study.
resources.notes: Excellent systematic approach to kanji learning.

resources.name: Japanese the Manga Way
resources.description: Learn Japanese grammar through manga examples.
resources.descriptionLong: Japanese the Manga Way teaches Japanese grammar using examples from real manga. It covers grammar points from basic to intermediate levels, showing how Japanese is actually used in popular media. A fun and engaging approach for manga fans.
resources.notes: Great supplement for manga enthusiasts.

resources.name: A Dictionary of Basic Japanese Grammar
resources.nameJa: 日本語文法辞典（基礎編）
resources.description: Essential grammar reference for Japanese learners.
resources.descriptionLong: A Dictionary of Basic Japanese Grammar is an indispensable reference book for Japanese learners. It provides detailed explanations of grammar points with numerous example sentences, usage notes, and comparisons with similar patterns. Part of a three-volume series covering basic, intermediate, and advanced grammar.
resources.notes: Must-have reference. Also available: Intermediate and Advanced volumes.

resources.name: A Dictionary of Intermediate Japanese Grammar
resources.nameJa: 日本語文法辞典（中級編）
resources.description: Intermediate grammar reference continuing the series.
resources.descriptionLong: A Dictionary of Intermediate Japanese Grammar continues the comprehensive grammar reference series. It covers more complex grammar patterns needed for intermediate to advanced study, with the same detailed explanations and examples as the basic volume.
resources.notes: Essential for intermediate learners.

resources.name: A Dictionary of Advanced Japanese Grammar
resources.nameJa: 日本語文法辞典（上級編）
resources.description: Advanced grammar reference completing the trilogy.
resources.descriptionLong: A Dictionary of Advanced Japanese Grammar completes the grammar dictionary trilogy. It covers sophisticated grammar patterns, nuanced expressions, and formal language needed for advanced proficiency.
resources.notes: For advanced learners and reference.

resources.name: Japanese From Zero! 1
resources.description: Beginner-friendly textbook with progressive kana introduction.
resources.descriptionLong: Japanese From Zero! is a beginner-friendly textbook series that gradually introduces hiragana throughout the lessons rather than all at once. This approach makes it less overwhelming for absolute beginners. The series includes video lessons online.
resources.notes: Good for absolute beginners. 5 books in the series.

resources.name: Marugoto: Japanese Language and Culture Starter
resources.description: Japan Foundation textbook focusing on communication and culture.
resources.descriptionLong: Marugoto is the official textbook series from the Japan Foundation, designed around the JF Standard for Japanese-Language Education. It emphasizes practical communication and cultural understanding, with separate Katsudoo (activities) and Rikai (comprehension) books.
resources.notes: Official Japan Foundation textbook. Free online resources available.

resources.name: Nihongo So-matome N3
resources.description: JLPT N3 preparation series covering all test sections.
resources.descriptionLong: Nihongo So-matome is a popular JLPT preparation series with separate books for grammar, vocabulary, kanji, reading, and listening. The N3 level books help learners prepare for the intermediate JLPT exam with daily study schedules.
resources.notes: Available for all JLPT levels. Separate books for each skill.

resources.name: Shin Kanzen Master N2
resources.description: Comprehensive JLPT N2 preparation series.
resources.descriptionLong: Shin Kanzen Master is considered one of the most thorough JLPT preparation series. The N2 books provide in-depth coverage of grammar, vocabulary, reading, and listening with detailed explanations and practice questions.
resources.notes: Most comprehensive JLPT prep. Available for all levels.

resources.name: TRY! JLPT N1
resources.nameJa: TRY! 日本語能力試験 N1
resources.description: JLPT N1 grammar preparation with clear explanations.
resources.descriptionLong: TRY! is a JLPT preparation series known for its clear grammar explanations and practical approach. The N1 book covers all grammar points needed for the highest level of the JLPT with example sentences and practice exercises.
resources.notes: Good for N1 grammar study. Available for all JLPT levels.
